item.description: "Despite the burgeoning public support for sustainable and energy-efficient design, actual progress is still slow in coming," says BSA president James Batchelor FAIA of Arrowstreet. As the guest speaker on April 15 at 6:00 pm in "Exploring Design," the BSA lecture series at the Boston Public Library, Batchelor shares some examples of sustainable and energy-efficient design to shed light on the gap between our aspirations and buildings' often-disappointing performance results. The presentation is free and open to the public.
item.name: Getting to green
